SENT.plain: Previous animal models of thromboembolic stroke have focused upon the carotid artery system
An alternative approach utilizing the vertebrobasilar system in rabbits is presented here
Left vertebral artery catheterization was accomplished relatively simply in this model using transfemoral angiographic techniques

Twenty-four-hour-old clot emboli with calculated volumes in the range of 0.007-0.11 cc were delivered by this route and found to lodge at the juncture of the basilar tip and the Circle of Willis in 11 of 13 rabbits
Intra-arterial infusion of streptokinase in one animal resulted in angiographically complete clearing of clot
Certain technical advantages in this particular approach are discussed
